title: Party Crashers, Witch Hunts and Ninja Costumes
teaser:
A collection of Moth GrandSLAM Stories from around the country.  A rabbinical student answers tough questions; a couple crashes the 2008 Obama inauguration; a teacher survives a witch hunt; a tween creates a homemade Halloween costume; a woman plans a sing-along funeral finale; and a man travels to Africa to find a higher purpose. Hosted by The Moth’s Senior Producer, Jenifer Hixson.

The Moth Radio Hour is produced by The Moth and Jay Allison of Atlantic Public Media.
description:
Aaron Potek fields a tough question as a rabbinical student.
Bonnie Levison crashes the 2008 Obama Inauguration.
Horace HB Sanders creates his own  halloween ninja costume.
Matthew Dicks is a third grade teacher under anonymous attack.
Cole Kazdin commemorates her theater friend’s life in a song.
Scott Holtzknecht is transformed by a little boy in Africa.
